LanguageData.NocturnalAnimals.BodyClock_Description: Determines when the animal sleeps and when it is awake.\n\nDiurnal animals sleep during the night and are awake during the day, while nocturnal animals sleep during the day and are awake during the night. Crepuscular animals are mainly active during dusk.
LanguageData.VEF_WarningEggExplodes: Warning, this egg explodes when hatching!
LanguageData.VEF_TerrainsNeedsDiggable: The terrain needs to be diggable to do this
LanguageData.VCE_AffectsAllAnimalMods: These animal behaviours options will affect all animal mods that share code from the Vanilla Expanded Framework
LanguageData.VCE_CorpseDecayingEffectOption: Allow corpse decaying mechanics (for example, Helixien slug's effect)
LanguageData.VCE_DigWhenHungryOption: Allow digging when hungry mechanics (for example, Frostmites digging corpses)
LanguageData.VCE_DigPeriodicallyOption: Allows animals digging for things periodically
LanguageData.VFE_AsexualReproductionDisabled: Asexual reproduction disabled via mod options
LanguageData.VCE_BuildPeriodicallyOption: Allow animals building things (for example, beavers building dams)
LanguageData.VCE_ChargeBatteriesOption: Allow animals recharging nearby batteries or refueling
LanguageData.VCE_ExplodingEggsOption: Allow animals' eggs that explode (such as dragons')
LanguageData.VCE_HoveringOption: Allow animals "hovering", ignoring terrain movement costs
LanguageData.VCE_GraphicChangingOption: Allow animals changing graphics (for example, Chameleon Yak)
LanguageData.VCE_EffecterOption: Allows animals causing hediffs, mental states or thoughts
LanguageData.VCE_ResurrectionOption: Allow animals to auto-resurrect (for example Phoenix Owlcat)
LanguageData.VCE_UntameableOption: Allow some animals to be untameable
